citation.article-title: Taxonomic studies on radio-resistant Pseudomonas. Part XII. Studies on the microorganisms of cereal grains.

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas radiora sp. nov.
Contains large globules of fat in a cell.
Nutrient agar colonies: Circular, smooth, entire, convex, glistening, pink to red, opaque.
Nutrient agar slant: Moderate growth, filiform, glistening, opaque, pink to red, medium
Glutamate agar slant: Moderate growth, red, medium unchanged.
Potato agar slant: Abundant growth, filiform, glistenning, red, medium unchanged.
Potato plug: Moderate growth, dull reddiash, brown.
Litmus milk: Alkaline, not peptonized, litmus not reduced.
Nitrate reduced to nitrite in succinate-nitrate.
Acid, but no gas from xylose, glucose, and glycerol; no acid and no gas from sucrose, lactose and starch in synthetic and peptone media.
Anaerobically no acid and no gas from glucose and lactose.
Glucose, gluconate, 2-keto-gluconate, citrate, succinate, ethanol, methanol, benzoate, salicylate, p-hydroxy benzoate assimilated.
Salt tolerance: Up to 0.5 percent in potato-peptone medium.
Optimum temperature: 20 to 32°C, no growth at 37°C.
O-1 was deposited in the J.
Culture Collection, Institute of Applied Microbiology, University of Tokyo, Japan, in 1971.
